intro: Schismatoglottis nervosa, commonly known as the veined schismatoglottis, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its sympodial growth habit. The plant features linear, dark green leaves with prominent veins, and its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Schismatoglottis nervosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
